t: John 6
After*p these things Jesus went over the sea of Galilee, which is the sea of Tiberias.
And*p a great multitude followed him, because they saw his miracles which he did on them that were diseased.
And*p Jesus went up into a mountain, and there he sat with his disciples.
And*p the passover, a feast of the Jews, was nigh.
When*p Jesus then lifted up his eyes, and saw a great company come unto him, he saith unto Philip, Whence*r shall*r we*r buy*r bread,*r that*r these*r may*r eat?*r
And*p this he said to prove him: for he himself knew what he would do.
Philip*p answered him, Two hundred pennyworth of bread is not sufficient for them, that every one of them may take a little.
One*p of his disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter's brother, saith unto him,
There*p is a lad here, which hath five barley loaves, and two small fishes: but what are they among so many?
And*p Jesus said, Make*r the*r men*r sit*r down.*r Now there was much grass in the place. So the men sat down, in number about five thousand.
And*p Jesus took the loaves; and when he had given thanks, he distributed to the disciples, and the disciples to them that were set down; and likewise of the fishes as much as they would.
When*p they were filled, he said unto his disciples, Gather*r up*r the*r fragments*r that*r remain,*r that*r nothing*r be*r lost.*r
Therefore*p they gathered them together, and filled twelve baskets with the fragments of the five barley loaves, which remained over and above unto them that had eaten.
Then*p those men, when they had seen the miracle that Jesus did, said, This is of a truth that prophet that should come into the world.
When*p Jesus therefore perceived that they would come and take him by force, to make him a king, he departed again into a mountain himself alone.
And*p when even was now come, his disciples went down unto the sea,
And*p entered into a ship, and went over the sea toward Capernaum. And it was now dark, and Jesus was not come to them.
And*p the sea arose by reason of a great wind that blew.
So*p when they had rowed about five and twenty or thirty furlongs, they see Jesus walking on the sea, and drawing nigh unto the ship: and they were afraid.
But*p he saith unto them, It*r is*r I;*r be*r not*r afraid.*r
Then*p they willingly received him into the ship: and immediately the ship was at the land whither they went.

The*p day following, when the people which stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was none other boat there, save that one whereinto his disciples were entered, and that Jesus went not with his disciples into the boat, but that his disciples were gone away alone;
(Howbeit*p there came other boats from Tiberias nigh unto the place where they did eat bread, after that the Lord had given thanks:)
When*p the people therefore saw that Jesus was not there, neither his disciples, they also took shipping, and came to Capernaum, seeking for Jesus.
And*p when they had found him on the other side of the sea, they said unto him, Rabbi, when camest thou hither?

Jesus*p answered them and said, Verily,*r verily,*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r Ye*r seek*r me,*r not*r because*r ye*r saw*r the*r miracles,*r but*r because*r ye*r did*r eat*r of*r the*r loaves,*r and*r were*r filled.*r

Labour*rp not*r for*r the*r meat*r which*r perisheth,*r but*r for*r that*r meat*r which*r endureth*r unto*r everlasting*r life,*r which*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r shall*r give*r unto*r you:*r for*r him*r hath*r God*r the*r Father*r sealed.*r
Then*p said they unto him, What shall we do, that we might work the works of God?
Jesus*p answered and said unto them, This*r is*r the*r work*r of*r God,*r that*r ye*r believe*r on*r him*r whom*r he*r hath*r sent.*r
They*p said therefore unto him, What sign shewest thou then, that we may see, and believe thee? what dost thou work?
Our*p fathers did eat manna in the desert; as it is written, He gave them bread from heaven to eat.

Then*p Jesus said unto them, Verily,*r verily,*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r Moses*r gave*r you*r not*r that*r bread*r from*r heaven;*r but*r my*r Father*r giveth*r you*r the*r true*r bread*r from*r heaven.*r
For*rp the*r bread*r of*r God*r is*r he*r which*r cometh*r down*r from*r heaven,*r and*r giveth*r life*r unto*r the*r world.*r
Then*p said they unto him, Lord, evermore give us this bread.
And*p Jesus said unto them, I*r am*r the*r bread*r of*r life:*r he*r that*r cometh*r to*r me*r shall*r never*r hunger;*r and*r he*r that*r believeth*r on*r me*r shall*r never*r thirst.*r
But*rp I*r said*r unto*r you,*r That*r ye*r also*r have*r seen*r me,*r and*r believe*r not.*r
All*rp that*r the*r Father*r giveth*r me*r shall*r come*r to*r me;*r and*r him*r that*r cometh*r to*r me*r I*r will*r in*r no*r wise*r cast*r out.*r
For*rp I*r came*r down*r from*r heaven,*r not*r to*r do*r mine*r own*r will,*r but*r the*r will*r of*r him*r that*r sent*r me.*r

And*rp this*r is*r the*r Father's*r will*r which*r hath*r sent*r me,*r that*r of*r all*r which*r he*r hath*r given*r me*r I*r should*r lose*r nothing,*r but*r should*r raise*r it*r up*r again*r at*r the*r last*r day.*r

And*rp this*r is*r the*r will*r of*r him*r that*r sent*r me,*r that*r every*r one*r which*r seeth*r the*r Son,*r and*r believeth*r on*r him,*r may*r have*r everlasting*r life:*r and*r I*r will*r raise*r him*r up*r at*r the*r last*r day.*r
The*p Jews then murmured at him, because he said, I*r am*r the*r bread*r which*r came*r down*r from*r heaven.*r
And*p they said, Is not this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? how is it then that he saith, I*r came*r down*r from*r heaven?*r
Jesus*p therefore answered and said unto them, Murmur*r not*r among*r yourselves.*r
No*rp man*r can*r come*r to*r me,*r except*r the*r Father*r which*r hath*r sent*r me*r draw*r him:*r and*r I*r will*r raise*r him*r up*r at*r the*r last*r day.*r

It*rp is*r written*r in*r the*r prophets,*r And*r they*r shall*r be*r all*r taught*r of*r God.*r Every*r man*r therefore*r that*r hath*r heard,*r and*r hath*r learned*r of*r the*r Father,*r cometh*r unto*r me.*r
Not*rp that*r any*r man*r hath*r seen*r the*r Father,*r save*r he*r which*r is*r of*r God,*r he*r hath*r seen*r the*r Father.*r
Verily,*rp verily,*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r He*r that*r believeth*r on*r me*r hath*r everlasting*r life.*r
I*rp am*r that*r bread*r of*r life.*r
Your*rp fathers*r did*r eat*r manna*r in*r the*r wilderness,*r and*r are*r dead.*r
This*rp is*r the*r bread*r which*r cometh*r down*r from*r heaven,*r that*r a*r man*r may*r eat*r thereof,*r and*r not*r die.*r

I*rp am*r the*r living*r bread*r which*r came*r down*r from*r heaven:*r if*r any*r man*r eat*r of*r this*r bread,*r he*r shall*r live*r for*r ever:*r and*r the*r bread*r that*r I*r will*r give*r is*r my*r flesh,*r which*r I*r will*r give*r for*r the*r life*r of*r the*r world.*r
The*p Jews therefore strove among themselves, saying, How can this man give us his flesh to eat?

Then*p Jesus said unto them, Verily,*r verily,*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r Except*r ye*r eat*r the*r flesh*r of*r the*r Son*r of*r man,*r and*r drink*r his*r blood,*r ye*r have*r no*r life*r in*r you.*r
Whoso*rp eateth*r my*r flesh,*r and*r drinketh*r my*r blood,*r hath*r eternal*r life;*r and*r I*r will*r raise*r him*r up*r at*r the*r last*r day.*r
For*rp my*r flesh*r is*r meat*r indeed,*r and*r my*r blood*r is*r drink*r indeed.*r
He*rp that*r eateth*r my*r flesh,*r and*r drinketh*r my*r blood,*r dwelleth*r in*r me,*r and*r I*r in*r him.*r
As*rp the*r living*r Father*r hath*r sent*r me,*r and*r I*r live*r by*r the*r Father:*r so*r he*r that*r eateth*r me,*r even*r he*r shall*r live*r by*r me.*r

This*rp is*r that*r bread*r which*r came*r down*r from*r heaven:*r not*r as*r your*r fathers*r did*r eat*r manna,*r and*r are*r dead:*r he*r that*r eateth*r of*r this*r bread*r shall*r live*r for*r ever.*r
These*p things said he in the synagogue, as he taught in Capernaum.
Many*p therefore of his disciples, when they had heard this, said, This is an hard saying; who can hear it?
When*p Jesus knew in himself that his disciples murmured at it, he said unto them, Doth*r this*r offend*r you?*r
What*rp and*r if*r ye*r shall*r see*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r ascend*r up*r where*r he*r was*r before?*r
It*rp is*r the*r spirit*r that*r quickeneth;*r the*r flesh*r profiteth*r nothing:*r the*r words*r that*r I*r speak*r unto*r you,*r they*r are*r spirit,*r and*r they*r are*r life.*r
But*rp there*r are*r some*r of*r you*r that*r believe*r not.*r For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were that believed not, and who should betray him.
And*p he said, Therefore*r said*r I*r unto*r you,*r that*r no*r man*r can*r come*r unto*r me,*r except*r it*r were*r given*r unto*r him*r of*r my*r Father.*r
From*p that time many of his disciples went back, and walked no more with him.
Then*p said Jesus unto the twelve, Will*r ye*r also*r go*r away?*r
Then*p Simon Peter answered him, Lord, to whom shall we go? thou hast the words of eternal life.
And*p we believe and are sure that thou art that Christ, the Son of the living God.
Jesus*p answered them, Have*r not*r I*r chosen*r you*r twelve,*r and*r one*r of*r you*r is*r a*r devil?*r
He*p spake of Judas Iscariot the son of Simon: for he it was that should betray him, being one of the twelve.
